intro: Rapanea kuebiniensis, commonly known as the Kuebini endemic tree, is a species native to the island of Kuebini in the South China Sea. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant has simple, opposite, and elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. Its small, fragrant flowers are white or pale yellow and are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
